label: artificial language
description: A language developed artificially by one or more persons to supply a specific use need.

label: extinct language
description: A language that has no remaining native speakers and no descendants.

label: lingua franca
description: A language adopted between speakers whose native languages are incompatible.

label: dead language
description: A language that is no longer in active use and survives only through documents.

label: natural language
description: A language developed naturally by people according to their communication needs.

label: dialect
description: A variety of a language that is characteristic of a particular group of the language's speakers.

label: sociolect
description: The variety of language, a dialect, used by a particular social class.

label: idiolect
description: A personâ€™s individual and unique use of language.
